title: Manager Big Data Architecture
description:
CSQ426R175
   

  

 As Manager of Resident Solutions Architects at Databricks, you will provide strategic leadership for delivering professional services engagements to high-value Databricks customers. You will help shape the future big data and machine learning landscape for leading Fortune 500 organizations. You will report directly to the Senior Manager of Professional Services in BeNeLux & Nordics.
   

  

 Part of this role will include a people-leadership capacity, responsible for core aspects of building and managing the Resident Solutions Architect team. Through your oversight and mentorship, this team will guide our largest customers, implementing pipelines spanning data engineering through model building and deployment, plus other technical tasks to help customers get value out of their data with Databricks. Beyond people leadership, your responsibilities will include owning the delivery of customer projects in your region to ensure they are managed and delivered to target and exacting standards. You will be an ambassador for Services and their value in the region, will represent the organisation in steering committees, and will work with cross-functional teams and leaders to ensure Services support the development of the local business.
   

  

**The Impact You Will Have**
* You will achieve regional team targets for billable utilization, hiring and revenue
* You will partner with account executives, customer success and field engineering leaders while guiding Resident Solutions Architects to achieve success with professional services projects with customers
* Help resolve customer concerns on strategic accounts and professional services engagements
* Analyze operational processes and escalation procedures and perform training needs assessments to identify opportunities for improving service delivery and contributing to customers
* Manage a team of Resident Solution Architects and act as a supportive manager, including handling escalations, mentoring team members, and building a career path for the assigned team members.


**What We Look For**
* Proven leadership experience in managing and guiding consulting, delivery, or solution architecture teams, ensuring successful project execution and team development
* Strong technical background as a hands-on Solutions Architect, enabling you to effectively support and mentor technical architects under your leadership while driving strategic initiatives
* Experience driving software platform adoption in Fortune 500 organizations in markets such as: Finance, Media, Retail, Telco, Energy, and Healthcare
* Implement a project schedule with experience with customer engagement
* Experience with Databricks products, Spark ecosystem, and direct competitors
* Travel is required up to 10%, more at peak times.


**About Databricks**
 Databricks is the data and AI company. More than 10,000 organizations worldwide — including Comcast, Condé Nast, Grammarly, and over 50% of the Fortune 500 — rely on the Databricks Data Intelligence Platform to unify and democratize data, analytics and AI. Databricks is headquartered in San Francisco, with offices around the globe and was founded by the original creators of Lakehouse, Apache Spark™, Delta Lake and MLflow. To learn more, follow Databricks on Twitter, LinkedIn and Facebook.
   

  

**Benefits**
 At Databricks, we strive to provide comprehensive benefits and perks that meet the needs of all of our employees. For specific details on the benefits offered in your region, please visit https://www.mybenefitsnow.com/databricks.
   

  

**Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion**
 At Databricks, we are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive culture where everyone can excel. We take great care to ensure that our hiring practices are inclusive and meet equal employment opportunity standards. Individuals looking for employment at Databricks are considered without regard to age, color, disability, ethnicity, family or marital status, gender identity or expression, language, national origin, physical and mental ability, political affiliation, race, religion, sexual orientation, socio-economic status, veteran status, and other protected characteristics.
   

  

**Compliance**
**If access to export-controlled technology or source code is required for performance of job duties, it is within Employer's discretion whether to apply for a U.S. government license for such positions, and Employer may decline to proceed with an applicant on this basis alone.**

title: Software & Solution Architect
description:
***This job is with EQT Group, an inclusive employer and a member of myGwork – the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community. Please do not contact the recruiter directly.***
**Join EQT’s Architectural function at Tech, where you’ll play a critical role in future-proofing and scaling one of our cross-functional value streams—the Client Value Stream.**
 This is a unique opportunity to design and drive the technology supporting our client journey - ensuring seamless integrations, efficiency, and innovation. If you're a strategic thinker with a strong technical foundation and a passion for designing scalable systems, we’d love to hear from you.
   

  

**About The Tech Team – Client Value Stream**
 The Client Value Stream empowers EQT with fit-for-purpose tools and services to deliver an excellent client experience while enhancing operational efficiency. We’re a cross-functional team collaborating closely with stakeholders across EQT to ensure data and technology strategically support client engagement and business outcomes. Our team includes tech leads, data professionals, product managers and architects who together shape the future of client interaction through scalable, data-driven solutions.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
 As an Software and Solution Architect, you will play a key role in shaping EQT’s technical landscape within the Client Value Stream. Your primary responsibility will be to collaborate with Tech Leads, Engineers, and external partners to design and implement solutions that drive efficiency and scalability across EQT’s investment technology.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Partner with tech leads and engineers to support the Client Value Stream in new projects & initiatives, engaging in technical discussions with both third-party service providers and internal teams to ensure a structured approach to solution development
* Assess the current architecture, team capabilities, and resource allocation to determine the best approach for future implementations
* Develop new architectural solutions and enhance existing ones to ensure they are harmonized, scalable, and efficient for all of EQT
* Establish technical standards, best practices, and improved ways of working across EQT’s Tech teams
* Collaborate with other Value Streams (Investment & Fintech) and Platform Teams to define interfaces, ownership, and capabilities within the Client domain
* Design system integrations, ensuring seamless connectivity between internal systems, new external systems, and vendors
* Work closely with the Head of Architecture and the Head of Client Tech, supporting key strategic initiatives


**Who are you?**
 We’re looking for an experienced Software and Solution Architect with a strong technical foundation and a strategic mindset. You should have a passion for problem-solving, system design, and technical leadership.
   

  

**Desired Skills & Experience**
* Background in software engineering, with hands-on experience in designing, building, and maintaining complex systems
* Experience designing high-availability systems that handle sensitive and complex data
* Strong understanding of system integrations, APIs, and data architectures
* Hands-on experience with modern data stacks and frameworks (e.g., dbt, Snowflake, SQL, Fivetran)
* Proven ability to drive implementation from initial requirements to high-level solution design and progress tracking
* Strong leadership and coaching skills, with the confidence to take a firm stance in technical discussions
* Excellent communication skills, able to engage effectively with key stakeholders, clients, and external partners
* Proactive mindset, with a desire to learn, adapt, and drive continuous improvement


**Nice-to-have!**
* Familiarity with Salesforce, CRM Analytics, PowerBI or Hex.
* Interest in leveraging AI and advanced analytics to drive business value and innovation
* A strong technical foundation with hands-on experience in data-intensive systems and modern data architectures


**What We Offer**
* A fast-paced and dynamic work environment at a leading global investment firm
* The opportunity to work with cutting-edge technology and develope the future of EQT’s investor & client tools
* A collaborative and inclusive company culture where innovation is encouraged
* Regular hackathons, workshops, and learning opportunities to develop new skills
* Competitive compensation and benefits package
* A vibrant office environment in Stockholm


**The Process**
 We’re excited to receive your application! Please note that we’ll begin the selection process in August and initiate interviews soon after.
   

  

**Inclusion at** 
**EQT**
*Our vision for EQT employees is to build high performing & engaged teams. Our competitive edge comes from fostering an environment where every individual feels valued, empowered, and motivated to drive business impact. Our commitment to inclusion is not just about fairness; We understand and believe that being a great place to work drives the best performance.At EQT, inclusion is a business imperative and it's embedded into our talent strategy, decision-making, and culture to ensure that every individual and team operates at their full potential. By doing so, we unlock better collaboration, stronger innovation, and superior investment outcomes.*
**About EQT**
*EQT is a purpose-driven global investment organization focused on active ownership strategies. With a Nordic heritage and a global mindset, EQT has a track record of almost three decades of developing companies across multiple geographies, sectors and strategies. EQT has investment strategies covering all phases of a business’ development, from start-up to maturity. EQT has EUR ‌ 269 billion in total assets under management (EUR ‌ ‌136 billion in fee-generating assets under management), within two business segments – Private Capital and Real Assets.
   

  

 With its roots in the Wallenberg family’s entrepreneurial mindset and philosophy of long-term ownership, EQT is guided by a set of strong values and a distinct corporate culture. EQT manages and advises funds and vehicles that invest across the world with the mission to future-proof companies, generate attractive returns and make a positive impact with everything EQT does. EQT has offices in more than 25 countries across Europe, Asia and the Americas and has more than 1,900 employees.*
*More info: www.eqtgroup.com
   

  

 Follow EQT on LinkedIn, X, YouTube and Instagram*

title: SAP Solution Architect in Sourcing and Procurement
description:
Scania is undergoing a transformation from being a leading supplier of trucks, buses, and engines to providing complete and sustainable transport solutions. Together with TRATON and our sister brands MAN, Volkswagen Truck & Bus, and International, we are working to shape the future of mobility with innovative and environmentally conscious solutions.
   

  

 Our values – customer first, respect, team spirit, responsibility, and elimination of waste – are at the heart of everything we do. Together, we are at the forefront of creating a sustainable future.
   

  

**This Is Us**
 At Scania, we are on an exciting journey of transformation—modernizing our industrial operations and evolving into a more data-centric, agile, and future-ready organization. Our Digital Core team plays a vital role in this journey by delivering world-class IT solutions, with SAP S/4HANA at the heart of our ERP backbone.
   

  

 We’re a collaborative, forward-thinking team working at the intersection of business and technology. Our work supports procurement, production, logistics, and finance—and we’re proud to help shape the foundation of Scania’s digital future.
   

  

 If you’re inspired by change, innovation, and making a real impact—this is where you belong.
   

  

**Role Summary**
 We are looking for an experienced SAP Solution Architect within the sourcing and procurement domain to help drive our SAP transformation. You will be part of our Source-to-Pay area, where you’ll work across functions to design scalable, efficient, and innovative SAP solutions.
   

  

 Your main mission will be to contribute to the setup and refinement of our global SAP template, ensuring alignment between business needs and our evolving system landscape. As a key part of the team, you’ll influence future direction, assess new SAP product opportunities, and guide technical design decisions in projects that span across Scania and the broader TRATON Group.
   

  

**Job Responsibilities**
* Lead architecture design and development activities within SAP S/4HANA for sourcing and procurement.
* Shape and evolve the global SAP template, supporting both ongoing and future project releases.
* Evaluate SAP tools (e.g., Central Procurement Hub, Fieldglass, SAP ECM) and identify opportunities for Scania.
* Safeguard solution integrity by promoting standard processes and scalable architecture.
* Collaborate with stakeholders to gather requirements, define scope, and support integration or customer-specific solutions.
* Guide change management and participate in review and governance processes.
* Share your knowledge with peers and contribute to Scania’s IT innovation culture.


**Who You Are**
 We believe you are a curious, solutions-oriented professional with a strong foundation in SAP sourcing and procurement. You’re as comfortable navigating complex technical challenges as you are engaging with stakeholders from different backgrounds.
   

  

 You likely bring:
   

  

  

* 5+ years’ experience in SAP sourcing and procurement, covering direct and/or indirect materials.
* Deep understanding of procurement business processes and system integration.
* Experience across multiple phases of SAP project lifecycles, ideally in S/4HANA environments.
* Familiarity with tools such as SAP BTP, Fieldglass, SAP ECM, VIM, and integrations with non-SAP systems (advantageous).
* Exposure to the automotive industry or other large-scale manufacturing environments (preferred).
* A collaborative and pragmatic mindset, with strong stakeholder management skills.
* Excellent communication skills in English (Swedish is a plus).


 You’re passionate about innovation, enjoy solving complex problems, and are excited to work in a space where your contributions can shape the future of an entire industry.
   

  

*We welcome applicants from all backgrounds – your unique experience and perspectives is valuable to us.*
**Scania Offers**
 We offer a dynamic, flexible workplace with hybrid work options, including Scania Sergel and Midway hubs. With a structured development plan and courses, Scania supports your career growth both locally and internationally.
   

  

 Benefits include training at our health center Gröndal or wellness allowance, result bonus, flexible hours, and company car leasing. Scania also hosts events for employees and their families, and Stockholm residents enjoy direct access to Södertälje via Scania Job express buses.
   

  

**Application**
*Due to summer vacation period, we will be going through all applications starting W.33*
 Your application should include a CV and any relevant certificates. We welcome all applicants and strive for diversity in our recruitment processes.
   

  

 Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check may be required for this role.
   

  

 If you have questions or would like more information, please contact: andy.arens@scania.com
   

  

**We look forward to your application!**

title: Creative Technologist, Kyndryl Vital, Nordics & Baltics
description:
**Who We Are**
 At Kyndryl, we design, build, manage and modernize the mission-critical technology systems that the world depends on every day. So why work at Kyndryl? We are always moving forward – always pushing ourselves to go further in our efforts to build a more equitable, inclusive world for our employees, our customers and our communities.
   

  

**The Role**
 The Role
   

  

 A Creative Technologist is a cross-disciplinary person that bridge between a design vision and engineering execution, using experimentation to solve problems in new and novel ways. They Combines technical expertise with human-centered design to prototype and implement innovative solutions. Creative technologists blend expertise in code, hardware, and emerging technologies to bring ideas to life.
   

  

 As a Creative Technologist at Kyndryl Vital Nordics and Baltics, you will:
   

  

* Collaborate with designers, engineers, and stakeholders to shape technical concepts aligned to human-centered design.
* Rapidly prototype interactive, testable experiences to drive alignment, learning, and value.
* Apply emerging technologies to business challenges, including AI/ML/GenAI, IoT, and immersive interfaces.
* Lead feasibility analysis and ethical review of technology choices.


 Required Technical and Professional Expertise
   

  

* Human-Centered Design: You have a deep understanding of human-centered design methods and mindset.
* Cross-disciplinary Collaboration: You excel at uniting design and engineering.
* Innovation: You can apply new applications for emerging tech.
* Rapid Prototyping: You can create context-appropriate, low- to high-fidelity digital and physical prototypes.
* Feasibility Analysis: You can assess design’s technical feasibility, system integration, and implementation pathways.
* Storytelling: You can translate prototypes and technical insights into compelling narratives.
* AI and Data Ethics: You leverage AI tools and data strategies with awareness of equity, bias, and transparency.


**Who You Are**
 Preferred Professional and Technical Expertise
   

  

* 3 plus years of relevant experience (dependent on level)
* Vertical domain experience (e.g., finance, retail, healthcare, industrial)
* Experience in both enterprise and agency worlds
* Knowledge and experience in IT infrastructure, architecture, and platform capabilities
* Background in behavioral science, change management, or design research
* Applied or academic experience with data science, AI/ML, or HCI


 You may specialize more deeply in:
   

  

* AI/ML/GenAI
* Phygital / Immersive Design
* IoT / Connected Product Design
* Mobile and Web Front-End Engineering


 Required Education
   

  

* Bachelor’s Degree in a relevant field (or equivalent demonstrable portfolio of work).


**Preferred Education**
* Advanced degree or certification in design, HCI, computer science, or related (e.g., MDM, MDes, MFA, d.MBA or equivalent) is a plus.


**Being You**
 Diversity is a whole lot more than what we look like or where we come from, it’s how we think and who we are. We welcome people of all cultures, backgrounds, and experiences. But we’re not doing it single-handily: Our Kyndryl Inclusion Networks are only one of many ways we create a workplace where all Kyndryls can find and provide support and advice. This dedication to welcoming everyone into our company means that Kyndryl gives you – and everyone next to you – the ability to bring your whole self to work, individually and collectively, and support the activation of our equitable culture. That’s the Kyndryl Way.
   

  

**What You Can Expect**
 With state-of-the-art resources and Fortune 100 clients, every day is an opportunity to innovate, build new capabilities, new relationships, new processes, and new value. Kyndryl cares about your well-being and prides itself on offering benefits that give you choice, reflect the diversity of our employees and support you and your family through the moments that matter – wherever you are in your life journey. Our employee learning programs give you access to the best learning in the industry to receive certifications, including Microsoft, Google, Amazon, Skillsoft, and many more. Through our company-wide volunteering and giving platform, you can donate, start fundraisers, volunteer, and search over 2 million non-profit organizations. At Kyndryl, we invest heavily in you, we want you to succeed so that together, we will all succeed.
   

  

**Get Referred!**
 If you know someone that works at Kyndryl, when asked ‘How Did You Hear About Us’ during the application process, select ‘Employee Referral’ and enter your contact's Kyndryl email address.

title: Leader and U&I Strategist - Kyndryl Vital in Nordics & Baltics
description:
**Who We Are**
 At Kyndryl, we design, build, manage and modernize the mission-critical technology systems that the world depends on every day. So why work at Kyndryl? We are always moving forward – always pushing ourselves to go further in our efforts to build a more equitable, inclusive world for our employees, our customers and our communities.
   

  

**The Role**
 As a Senior Service Design and Strategist for Kyndryl Vital Nordics & Baltics you’ll be a critical member of a cross-disciplinary team, leading innovative projects and modelling co-creative, human-centred behaviours. On customer engagements, you’ll be the design strategist and design leader. You’ll guide the team through the co-creatin phase, providing insights, ideas, and leadership to deliver high-quality, breakthrough solutions. You’ll be an ambassador for human-centred design to co-workers, partners, and customers, building awareness and including them in the journey. You’ll work with Kyndryl Vital Global leaders to identify high-potential customer projects and you will constantly look for more ways to add value to our customer’s experience.
   

  

 You’ll partner with Kyndryl business and account leaders, Consult Partners, technical strategists and architects, customers stakeholders, and Kyndryl’s alliance partners to define problems, imagine solutions and service blueprints, and enable all to bring these solutions to life. We’re in start-up mode so you’ll have a lot of influence over the ways of working both locally and at the global level. You’ll ensure we connect with the other global Kyndryl Vital teams, and contribute case studies, best practices, and other learnings to our global practice.

 Experience Designer/Facilitator

* Lead teams to collaborate on research/insights, defining problems, identifying ideas and service blueprints + understand technology to bring projects/solutions to life
* Work with customer/account teams to ensure Kyndryl Vital workshop outcomes are appropriately summarised, developed and extended into downstream Consult revenue opportunities.

* Build awareness, create trust and clearly communicate Kyndryl Vital Nordics & Baltics strategy and value proposition – both internally and with customers
* Support thought leadership agenda to raise profile and build reputation - both internally and with customers.

* Entrepreneurial mindset, thrive in ambiguity and enjoy ‘first of a kind challenges.’
* Systems-thinking problem-solver who looks through multiple lenses (business, people, technology, sustainability) and integrates those insights into innovative solutions
* Business acumen and language to work with customers, define key business objectives and create high-level business cases
* Lead multi-discipline teams through a service design and blueprinting engagement, resulting in experience-based roadmaps that enable technologists to dig more deeply into solutions
* Broad and flexible toolkit for designing co-creation journeys to lead teams from exploration to ideation. Adept at designing new tools when needed.
* Excellent collaboration and communication skills with clients and internal stakeholders
* Technology interest and acumen in some form
* Strong presentation skills in pre-sales environment
* Attention to detail in the language and relationship dynamics of key stakeholders.

* Experience in IT enterprise or IT environment
* Participatory design and research
* Knowledge and experience in IT infrastructure or other technical applications
* Human behaviour, change management, or other applied social sciences
* Data science, AI/ML, algorithm design experience
* Proficiency with tools such as Microsoft Suite, Miro or Mural, & other digital collaboration tools
* Experience in DesignOps or otherwise experienced in design-specific process and methodologies.

Through our company-wide volunteering and giving platform, you can donate, start fundraisers, volunteer, and search over 2 million non-profit organizations. **Get Referred!**
 If you know someone that works at Kyndryl, when asked ‘How Did You Hear About Us’ during the application process, select ‘Employee Referral’ and enter your contact's Kyndryl email address.

title: Senior Underwriter and Risk Analyst
description:
**Intro**
 At Pleo, we’re on a mission to revolutionise the way businesses manage company spending. No more outdated processes, clunky spreadsheets, or frustrating delays – we believe spend management should be seamless, empowering, and surprisingly effective for finance teams and employees alike. We’re creating tools that promote autonomy, foster trust, and let businesses focus on what truly matters.
   

  

 Our culture is built on transparency, collaboration, and a deep commitment to innovation – which is reflected in our spending solution. At Pleo, you’ll join a passionate team shaping the future of work, all while having some fun along the way.
   

  

**About The Role**
 We're looking for a Senior Underwriter & Risk Analyst to join our Credit Domain Team at Pleo. In this role, you'll help manage and optimise our credit portfolio and support the development of scalable risk processes. You'll be part of an ambitious cross-functional team as we scale our credit offerings and deliver smarter financial tools for our customers. If you're excited about building something from the ground up, love solving complex risk challenges, and are passionate about empowering businesses through better cash flow, this is the opportunity for you.
   

  

**What You’ll Be Doing**
 As a Senior Underwriter and Risk Analyst, you will:
   

  

* Underwrite applications for large credit facilities that fall outside our automated flows
* Monitor the health of our credit portfolio and identify improvement opportunities across policies and decision-making processes
* Collaborate closely with Product and Operations teams to define requirements and automate manual workflows for efficiency
* Contribute to the ongoing evolution of our credit risk framework, feeding insights into strategic decisions


**What You Bring**
 You’ll thrive in this role if you have:
   

  

* Solid experience in credit risk management and underwriting in the SME lending space
* A data-driven mindset, with the ability to monitor and improve portfolio performance
* Strong problem-solving skills and a proactive, solutions-oriented approach
* Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills – you're comfortable making the complex simple
* Experience using SQL and Power BI (or similar tools) to analyse and interpret risk data


**Who You’ll Be Working With And Reporting To**
 You’ll report to our Credit Lead and work closely with cross-functional teammates in Product, Operations, Finance, and Engineering. Our Credit Domain is built on collaboration and end-to-end ownership, you’ll be joining a driven, thoughtful team that’s passionate about delivering value to our customers and innovating at every turn.
   

  

**How You’ll Develop In This Role**
 In your first 3 to 6 months at Pleo, you’ll:
   

  

* Partner with product and data teams to enhance credit decisioning and automate key workflows
* Deepen your expertise in portfolio analysis and credit risk modelling
* Contribute directly to shaping Pleo’s credit offering as we grow our presence in business lending


**Show me the benefits!**
* Your own Pleo card (no more out-of-pocket spending!)
* Lunch is on us for your work days - enjoy catered meals or receive a lunch allowance based on your local office 🍜
* Comprehensive private healthcare - depending on your location, coverage options include Vitality, Alan or Médis
* We offer 25 days of holiday + your public holidays
* For our Team, we offer both hybrid and fully remote working options
* Option to purchase 5 additional days of holiday through a salary sacrifice
* We use MyndUp to give our employees access to free mental health and well-being support with great success so far ❤️‍🩹
* Access to LinkedIn Learning - acquire new skills, stay abreast of industry trends and fuel your personal and professional development continuously
* Paid parental leave - we want to make sure that we're supportive of families and help you feel that you don't have to compromise your family due to work 👶


**Why join us?**
 Working at Pleo means you're working on something very exciting: the future of work. Our mission is to help every company go beyond the books. Pleo itself means ‘more than you’d expect’, and it’s been the secret to our success over the last 8 years. So it’s only fitting that we’d pass this philosophy onto our customers to help them make the most of their finances.
   

  

 We think company spending should be delegated to all employees and teams, that it should be as automated as possible, and that it should drive a culture of responsible spending. Finance teams shouldn’t be siloed from the rest of the organisation – they should work in unity with marketing, sales, IT and everyone else.
   

  

 Speaking of working in unity, our values tell the story of how we work at Pleo. We have four core values, the first of which is ‘champion the customer’, which means we address real pain points that businesses face. Next up is ‘succeed as a team’, which highlights how our strength lies in our diversity and trust in each other. We also ‘make it happen’ by taking bold decisions and following through to deliver results. Last but not least, we ‘build to scale’, creating lasting solutions that address today’s challenges and anticipate tomorrow’s needs.
   

  

 So, in a nutshell, that's Pleo. Today we are a 850+ team, from over 100 nations, sitting in our Copenhagen HQ, London, Stockholm, Berlin, Madrid, Montreal and Lisbon offices —and quite a few full-time remotes in 35 other countries! Being HQ'd out of Copenhagen means we're inspired by things like a good work-life balance. If you don't work in the office with us, we'll help you set up the best remote setup possible
 *and* 
 make sure you still have time to connect with your team.
   

  

**About Your Application**
* Please submit your application in English; it’s our company language so you’ll be speaking lots of it if you join 💕
* We treat all candidates equally: If you are interested please apply through our application system - any correspondence should come from there! Our lovely support isn't able to pass on any calls/ emails our way - and this makes sure that the candidate experience is smooth and fair to everyone 😊
* We’re on a mission to make everyone feel valued at work. That’s only achievable if our team reflects the diversity of the world around us - and that starts with you, hitting apply, even if you are worried you might not tick all the boxes! We embrace and encourage people from all backgrounds to apply - regardless of race/ethnicity, colour, religion, nationality, gender, sex, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, neurodiversity, socio-economic status, culture or beliefs
* When you submit an application we process your personal data as a data processor. Find out more about how your data is used in the FAQs section at the bottom of our jobs page

title: Security Manager | EY Nordics | Stockholm
description:
At EY, we’re all in to shape your future with confidence.
   

  

 We’ll help you succeed in a globally connected powerhouse of diverse teams and take your career wherever you want it to go.
   

  

 Join EY and help to build a better working world.
   

  

**The opportunity**
 In EY, we aim to create a Better Working World and lead the Future of Work. A vital part of this mission is enhancing our unique Workplace Experience for employees and guests while ensuring safety and transparency regarding potential risks. We prioritize the security of our people and the confidentiality of client data with robust security measures in place.
   

  

 The Security Manager will play a crucial role in our Workplace Experience leadership team in the Nordics, overseeing security for over 9,500 EY employees across 110 offices in four countries. This position supports our commitment to providing the best Workplace Experience (WX) to empower our people in serving clients effectively.
   

  

 As a global pilot within EY, we strive to be the best among professional service firms. The Security Manager will report to the Nordic Head of Workplace Experience Operations and collaborate with the European Centre of Excellence for physical security, Nordic Risk Management, and key internal stakeholders.
   

  

**Your Key Responsibilities**
 As the Security Manager, you will oversee the following processes at a Nordic level within physical security:
   

  

* Risk Management: Identify, assess, and mitigate security risks to protect assets, employees, and information.
* Incident Response: Develop and implement incident response plans, leading the response to security incidents and emergencies.
* Managing Security Operations: Oversee security operations across multiple facilities, ensuring effective implementation and maintenance of security measures.
* Training and Awareness: Conduct security training and awareness programs to foster a security-conscious culture.


 Being responsible entails developing and maintaining concepts, policies, and guidelines, while driving activities that enhance awareness and behaviors among our people and leadership. Close coordination and stakeholder engagement are essential for success in our complex organization, and some travel may be required.
   

  

**Skills And Attributes For Success**
* An education or equivalent experience at bachelor’s or master’s degree level
* 5+ years of relevant professional experience
* Project management skills and a results-oriented mindset
* Empathy and great stakeholder management skills
* Good communication skills in English and one of the Scandinavian languages (verbal and written)


**Ideally, you’ll also**
* Have relevant training and certifications in the security space


**What We Offer You**
 At EY, we’ll develop you with future-focused skills and equip you with world-class experiences. We’ll empower you in a flexible environment, and fuel you and your extraordinary talents in a diverse and inclusive culture of globally connected teams. Learn more.
   

  

 Are you ready to shape your future with confidence? Apply today.
   

  

 The application deadline is August 15th, 2025. We will start the interviewing process after the application deadline due to summer vacations. Please submit your CV and cover letter online. For inquiries about the position, contact Thomas Forchhammer at Thomas.Forchhammer@dk.ey.com, and for recruitment process questions, reach out to Simon Aspler at simon.aspler@se.ey.com.
   

  

 Note that a background check will be conducted as part of the recruitment process.
   

  

 At EY, we celebrate diversity and encourage applications from individuals of all backgrounds. If you have any questions, require assistance, or need adjustments to the recruitment process due to a disability, please don't hesitate to reach out to us at recruitmentsweden@se.ey.com. We are here to support you.
   

  

**EY | Building a better working world**
 EY is building a better working world by creating new value for clients, people, society and the planet, while building trust in capital markets.
   

  

 Enabled by data, AI and advanced technology, EY teams help clients shape the future with confidence and develop answers for the most pressing issues of today and tomorrow.
   

  

 EY teams work across a full spectrum of services in assurance, consulting, tax, strategy and transactions. Fueled by sector insights, a globally connected, multi-disciplinary network and diverse ecosystem partners, EY teams can provide services in more than 150 countries and territories.

title: AI Solution Manager
description:
Vill du vara med att forma och utveckla hur AI används i en av Nordens mest dynamiska IT-organisationer? På itm8 söker vi nu en person som vill driva konkreta AI-initiativ i vår verksamhet samt till våra kunder – med fokus på både Microsofts AI-plattformar och andra ledande teknologier som Nvidia, Meta och open source-ramverk.



Som AI Solution Manager hos oss blir du en nyckelperson i att identifiera, utveckla och implementera AI-lösningar som förbättrar våra interna processer. Du kommer att arbeta nära verksamheten för att förstå behov, prioritera use cases och omsätta idéer till skalbara lösningar. Du får också en viktig roll i att höja AI-mognaden i organisationen genom workshops, utbildningar och förändringsledning.

  

##### **Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter inkluderar:**


* Identifiera och prioritera interna AI-use cases (t.ex. automatisk ticket-routing, prediktivt underhåll, offertautomatisering)
* Utveckla och produktionssätta AI-lösningar i samarbete med verksamheten
* Arbeta med Microsoft Copilot, Azure AI Services, Power Platform – samt gärna även andra AI-ramverk som TensorFlow, PyTorch, HuggingFace, Nvidia AI eller Meta Llama
* Bidra till AI-governance, best practices och intern kunskapsspridning
* Hålla dig uppdaterad om trender inom AI och föreslå nya verktyg och metoder
* Stötta i externa kunddialoger där AI är en strategisk komponent
* Vara delaktig som expert i itm8 AI council

##### **Vi ser gärna att du har några års erfarenhet inom:**

* Leda och utveckla AI/ML-projekt, självklart i någon molnmiljö
* Goda kunskaper i Python och ML-ramverk som scikit-learn, spaCy, Transformers
* AI-livscykeln i form av modellträning, inferens, drift, MLOps
* Arbetat med LLM:er, NLP, generativ AI och prompt engineering
* Kommunicera AI-koncept på ett pedagogiskt och inspirerande sätt för olika målgrupper


Meriterande är om du även har erfarenhet inom:


* Erfarenhet av Microsoft Copilot, Azure OpenAI, Power Platform.
* Kunskap om AI-tillämpningar inom DevOps, ERP, CRM eller BI.
* Intresse för datahantering, dataskydd och AI-governance.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta i matrisorganisationer och leda förändring.


itm8 är en av Nordens ledande leverantörer av digital transformation och IT-tjänster. Läs mer om vår resa på www.itm8.se och följ oss på Instagram @itm8inside.



Redo att utmana och utmanas inom AI med itm8?  

Vi ser fram emot din ansökan! Om du har frågor, skriv till oss i meddelanderutan nedan så följer vi upp med dig. Vi behandlar alla ansökningar och kontakter konfidentiellt och intervjuar löpande och rekommenderar att du söker tjänsten så snart som möjligt.

  


#LI-EMHUM #LI-Hybrid #itm8Sverige

title: Workday Integrations Engineer
description:
**About Wolt**
 At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we’re building the delivery of (almost) everything and you’ll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.
   

  

 Working at Wolt isn’t always easy, but it’s definitely exciting. Here you’ll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You’ll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you’re a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.
   

  

 At Wolt, our People Tech team is on a mission to empower our people through smart, seamless HR technology. As a Workday Integrations Engineer, you’ll play a critical role in building, maintaining, and evolving the digital backbone that connects our people systems—driving efficiency, accuracy, and scalability across our global operations.
   

  

 Join us and help shape how Wolt’s 12,000+ employees experience HR technology every day.
   

  

 📍This role can be based in Bucharest, Budapest, Helsinki, Stockholm. If you are based in Romania, Hungary, Finland or Sweden, remote work is also an option.
   

  

 What You’ll Be Doing
   

  

* Design and develop integrations between Workday and other internal/external systems using tools like Workday Studio, EIB, Core Connectors, PECI, and Picof.
* Build and enhance Workday Extend applications in close collaboration with HR and business stakeholders.
* Own the lifecycle of integrations—from design and implementation to testing, documentation, and support.
* Ensure system security and compliance, aligning with audit frameworks like SOC and SOX.
* Drive innovation by identifying opportunities to improve and automate HR workflows.
* Collaborate cross-functionally to understand business needs and translate them into technical solutions.
* Lead integration-related efforts for Workday system upgrades and feature releases.


 What We’re Looking For
   

  

* 5+ years of experience in Workday integrations.
* Proficiency in Workday Studio, EIBs, Core Connectors, BIRT, PECI, and Document Transformation.
* Experience with XSLT, XTT/ETV, and complex report building.
* Strong analytical and communication skills, with a high standard of discretion and reliability.
* A proactive mindset and the ability to lead integration projects end-to-end.
* Workday integration certification is a plus.


 Why You’ll Love It Here
   

  

 At Wolt, we’re building more than just great software—we’re building an employee experience that scales with every new hire and every global expansion. You'll have the autonomy to take ownership, the opportunity to innovate, and the platform to grow in one of Europe’s most dynamic tech environments.
   

  

 Come help us create the next generation of people tech at Wolt!
   

  

 https://youtu.be/GoL541\_xj9w
   

  

 Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion
   

  

 We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

title: Senior Backend Engineer (Python), Cart & Checkout, Consumer Group
description:
**About Wolt**
 At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we’re building the delivery of (almost) everything and you’ll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.
   

  

 Working at Wolt isn’t always easy, but it’s definitely exciting. Here you’ll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You’ll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you’re a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.
   

  

 The Cart & Checkout team is looking for Senior Backend Engineers! This team’s mission is to offer an amazing order experience; helping consumers to order in a fast, easy and collaborative way while providing a delightful user experience in different product lines.The team is responsible for the full order experience, one of the main flows in our consumer app and web, used by more than 40M users in 30 countries.
   

  

 Some of the team's key focus areas are baskets management, cart review, checkout experience, group orders and double orders. At the same time, the team owns and maintains a tier 0 service, therefore, we follow SRE practices, maintain and develop new features based on this service.
   

  

 Cart and Checkout is a cross-functional team covering 4 stacks: Frontend, Backend, iOS and Android. Which is supported by a QA engineer, a Data Analyst, a designer, a Team Tead and a Product Lead.
   

  

 This role can be based in one of our tech hubs in Helsinki, Tallinn, Berlin or Stockholm or you can work from home anywhere in any of those countries and enjoy up to 30 days of remote from abroad per year.
   

  

**Our humble expectations**
 We are looking for a technical leader with a background in building massively scalable distributed backend services using Python, integrated with MongoDB, Postgres DB, internal gRPC services, Kafka, Kubernetes and delivering modern, testable and maintainable code.
   

  

 We build some of our newer services in Kotlin, so while prior experience is a nice bonus, it’s not a must-have. What matters most is that you’re open and excited to work with Kotlin as part of the stack. In addition to the software development skills, we are looking for a team player with great communication and collaboration skills, flexibility and an agile attitude along with a product oriented mindset. We expect you to have these too!
   

  

**Next steps**
 The position will be filled as soon as we find the right person, so make sure to apply as soon as you realize you really, really want to join us!
   

  

 The compensation will be combination of monthly pay and DoorDash RSUs. The latter makes it exceptionally easy to be excited about our company growing and doing well, as you’ll own a piece of the pie.
   

  

 Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion
   

  

 We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

title: Kotlin Backend Engineer - Merchant Group
description:
**About Wolt**
 At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we’re building the delivery of (almost) everything and you’ll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.
   

  

 Working at Wolt isn’t always easy, but it’s definitely exciting. Here you’ll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You’ll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you’re a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.
   

  

 We’re looking for experienced Software Engineers to join various teams within the Merchant Group at Wolt! If you have a strong track record of building and maintaining scalable, production-grade systems and want to drive impact at scale, this is the place for you.
   

  

**Who We Are**
 The Merchant Group consists of 150+ engineers across 25+ cross-functional teams, working together to help merchants grow their businesses and streamline operations through innovative technology. Some of us focus on building seamless experiences for our merchants, while others work on the behind-the-scenes magic that makes everything run smoothly.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
 As an engineer in our group, you’ll work on production-level microservices in Kotlin, helping shape how merchants succeed with Wolt. You’ll have opportunities to:
   

  

* Design, build, and scale reliable systems that power merchant experiences.
* Work across the full development lifecycle – from business logic and testing to cloud infrastructure and data streaming.
* Collaborate on architecture and technology choices that keep our systems simple, scalable, and efficient.
* Grow your skills and knowledge by working alongside experienced teammates in an environment that values learning and experimentation.


**How We Work**
* Autonomy & Ownership – Our engineers have end-to-end responsibility for their services, from implementation to production.
* Collaboration – Architecture and working methods are defined together, ensuring we make the best choices for long-term success.
* Scalability & Simplicity – We value pragmatic solutions that keep our systems robust without unnecessary complexity. We use technologies that serve Wolt, our teams, and our engineers best. You’ll have the freedom to experiment and adopt the tools that work.


 Find out more by checking out our Kotlin-related Tech Talks below:
   

  

* Scaling Kotlin Backend Development Podcast
* Kotlin at Wolt
* Kotlin Meetup


**Our Tech Stack**
 Our core technologies include Kotlin (Ktor, Koin, Spring, gRPC), PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Kafka, Redis, GitHub Actions, AWS, Docker, and Kubernetes.
   

  

**Why Join Us?**
 No matter your level, Wolt is a place where you can learn, teach, and grow. If you’re passionate about building great technology and working in an environment that values teamwork and autonomy, we’d love to hear from you!
   

  

 📍These open roles can be based in our tech hubs in Helsinki, Stockholm and Tallinn. You can choose whether you want to work from home, from the office or hybrid.
   

  

 Our humble expectations
   

  

 We’re seeking experienced Software Engineers with a strong background in building scalable microservices. While Kotlin is our primary language, experience with Java, Scala, or other JVM backend languages is great - if you’re confident in your ability to learn, we’d love to hear from you! 🛠️
   

  

 Beyond technical expertise, we value ownership, collaboration, and a mindset for growth. You thrive in tackling complex challenges, questioning conventions, and working closely with teammates to build reliable, scalable systems. 🚀
   

  

 Next steps
   

  

 We are hiring for multiple open positions across different teams in the Merchant Group. During the initial screening call our Talent Acquisition Partner will discuss with you your expectations and possible domain preferences as well as share more about the group. After the recruiter screening call, during the rest of the interviewing steps, you’ll meet hiring managers and software engineers from the Merchant group, a specific team being proposed at the end of the process - that’s the moment when you’ll get to meet your possible Team Lead. Throughout the process, we will do our best to match your experience, skills, and aspirations with the most suitable Engineering team!
   

  

 The compensation will be a negotiable combination of monthly pay and DoorDash RSUs. The latter makes it exceptionally easy to be excited about our company growing and doing well, as you’ll own a piece of the pie.
   

  

 For any further questions about the position, you can turn to Product+ Talent Acquisition Partner - Severi Kausola severi.kausola(at)wolt.com
   

  

 Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion
   

  

 We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

title: MicroStrategy
description:
På B3 Indes förvandlar vi data till värdefulla insikter som driver förändring och innovation. Vi skapar lösningar inom AI, Business Intelligence, Data Science och Automation för att maximera värdet av data och stärka företags konkurrenskraft. Vår styrka ligger i att kombinera passion för AI och data med en stark laganda, där vi stöttar varandra och löser utmaningar tillsammans.
   

  

**Rollen som konsult inom konsult på B3:**
 Hos oss får du chansen att arbeta med några av Sveriges mest framåtlutade organisationer. Du som har gedigen erfarenhet av MicroStrategy kommer här till din rätt – hos oss får du:
   

  

* Utveckla och optimera MicroStrategy-lösningar som gör verklig skillnad hos våra kunder.
* Arbeta med hela kedjan – från schemaobjekt och komplexa mått till rapporter och dashboards.
* Bidra till lösningsarkitektur och prestandaoptimering i storskaliga MicroStrategy-implementationer.
* Designa och konfigurera säkerhetsmodeller, roller och åtkomstkontroller som säkerställer dataskydd och användarbehörighet.
* Tillsammans med kollegor och kunder modellera datalagerlösningar och implementera avancerade BI-plattformar.
* Dela med dig av din expertis i ett team som präglas av samarbete, nyfikenhet och teknisk höjd.


 Vi söker dig som trivs i en roll där du får vara både teknisk specialist och rådgivare – någon som inte bara kan skapa lösningar i MicroStrategy, utan också förstår den större bilden och kan vägleda kunder mot långsiktigt hållbara dataplattformar.
   

  

**Är det här du?**
 Vi tror att du har flera års erfarenhet av att arbeta med MicroStrategy och behärskar hela plattformen – från att skapa schemaobjekt och komplexa mått till att bygga användarvänliga dashboards och rapporter. Du har en god känsla för hur man skapar robusta och skalbara lösningar, och har troligen arbetat med MicroStrategys olika komponenter i större BI-implementationer.
   

  

 Du har koll på SQL och har jobbat med datalagerlösningar (DWH), och du är van att tänka på prestanda, struktur och säkerhet i allt du gör. Att konfigurera roller, behörigheter och säkerhetsfilter är en naturlig del av ditt arbete, och du gillar när det är ordning och reda i lösningarna du bygger.
   

  

 Vi ser gärna att du har jobbat som konsult tidigare – och att du trivs med att växla mellan projekt, branscher och kundutmaningar. Flytande svenska och engelska är ett måste, eftersom vi jobbar i båda språken dagligen.
   

  

**Och om du dessutom...**
* har erfarenhet av någon av de stora molnplattformarna (som AWS eller Azure),
* kan navigera i andra BI-verktyg som Power BI eller Tableau,
* har jobbat i miljöer med Snowflake, Databricks eller liknande,
* eller är van vid DevOps-flöden och verktyg som Visual Studio –
* då har du lite extra stjärnglans i vår bok!


**Varför välja B3 Indes?**
 💡
 **Utveckling & karriär** 
 – Väx i en entreprenörsdriven miljö där din kompetens får ta plats.
   

  

 🌿
 **Balans & välmående** 
 – Vi värnar om ditt välbefinnande med stöd för wellness och en flexibel vardag.
   

  

 🚀
 **Energi & gemenskap** 
 – Här präglas kulturen av öppenhet, nyfikenhet och en passion för att skapa något större – tillsammans.
   

  

 ❤️
 **Vi bryr oss – på riktigt** 
 – Vi engagerar oss i samhällsfrågor och samarbetar med initiativ som Suicide Zero, My Dream Now och Pink Programming för att göra skillnad även utanför arbetslivet.
   

  

**En arbetsplats som gör skillnad:**
 Vi är stolta över att ha utsetts till ett av
 **Sveriges fem främsta karriärföretag 2025** 
 – en utmärkelse som speglar vår energi, nyfikenhet och vårt engagemang för att skapa en inkluderande och inspirerande arbetsplats. Här värdesätts olika perspektiv och idéer, och vi tror att det är just det som gör oss starkare.
   

  

 Hos oss får du friheten att styra över dina uppdrag, din arbetstid och din utveckling. Vi erbjuder
 **konkurrenskraftiga löner** 
 , flexibilitet att forma din vardag och en sund balans mellan jobb och fritid. Och vi vet att
 **gemenskap är minst lika viktigt som teknik** 
 – därför satsar vi på allt från konferensresor och sommarfester till sköna AW:s där vi kan släppa jobbet för en stund.
   

  

**Om B3 Consulting Group**
*B3 Consulting Group är ett expansivt konsultbolag med cirka 1000 medarbetare. Vi brinner för innovation och hjälper Sveriges ledande företag och organisationer att skapa framtidens möjligheter genom digital transformation. B3 finns på tolv orter i Sverige samt i Polen, med huvudkontor i Stockholm. Bolaget grundades 2003, är noterat på Nasdaq Stockholm Small Cap och omsatte 1 141 MSEK 2023.*
*Vi är stolta över vår prisbelönta företagskultur, där olikheter, erfarenheter och gemensam energi värdesätts. Som ett etiskt och transparent bolag strävar vi efter att ha en positiv påverkan på samhället, människor och miljön. Vi är även engagerade i Women in Tech och initiativ för att stärka AI-utbildning för kvinnor. 2024 utsågs vi till Årets Employer Branding-företag, och vår HR-chef vann titeln Årets HR-chef.*

title: Experienced Video Coding Researcher
description:
**Join our Team**
**About This Opportunity**
 Ericsson's 6G vision, first introduced in 2020, remains pivotal for transforming business and society in the 2030s through secure, efficient, and sustainable communication services. Video, which is estimated to account for nearly 75% of all mobile data traffic, is an essential part of this vision and a key enabler of the emerging services anticipated in the 6G cyber-physical world. To meet the ever-increasing demands of deploying existing and future video services at scale, video coding technologies and standards continue to evolve, aiming to provide more efficient, flexible, scalable, and sustainable ways of delivering video services to consumers and businesses world-wide.
   

  

 The pace of innovation in video coding has never been as fast as now encompassing both advanced signal processing and neural network-based compression techniques. As a researcher in our team, you will be at the forefront of this development. You will invent, implement, and evaluate video coding algorithms that will become part of next generation video coding standards. You will produce software implementing novel video coding algorithms, write standardization contributions, academic publications, and patent applications.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
* Be working in an international team of world class researchers in video coding.
* Have your research validated and recognized in a competitive standardization environment comprising world-class experts and leaders in the video coding community.
* Be working in a dynamic department with opportunities for learning, taking on new responsibilities, impacting ways of working, and much more.


**The Skills You Bring**
* M.Sc. or Ph.D. in a relevant technical area.
* Passion and strong skills in programming.
* Interest and curiosity for solving problems and delivering innovative solutions.
* Experience with object-oriented languages such as C++ and Python.
* Experience and interest in video coding.
* Experience and interest in signal processing and neural networks applied to video coding and processing.
* Familiarity with video coding standards such as H.265/HEVC and H.266/VVC.
* Track record in publishing in scientific journals and delivering presentations at standardization meetings, academic conferences or relevant industry events.


 We are looking forward to your application in English where you describe the value of your experience and skills in the above technical area.
   

  

**Application end date: August 15, 2025.**
**Why join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
   

  

**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.
   

  

**Primary country and city:** 
 Sweden (SE) || Stockholm
   

  

**Req ID:** 
 763752

title: Solutions Architects inom Data, Cloud, Integration eller...
description:
*På TechSeed är vi övertygade om att det är tekniken som kommer göra världen till en bättre plats. Vi ser ett stort behov i vårt samhälle att kombinera affärsförståelse, digitalt ledarskap samt innovativa arbetssätt och lösningar med framtidens tekniker i uppkopplade ekosystem. Vi tror på en hållbar framtid med säkra lösningar genom exempelvis IoT-lösningar, digitala tvillingar, AI och cybersäkerhet. Det här är vårt WHY och det fyller oss med energi varje dag. Det här är vår arena.*


TechSeed är ett medarbetarägt konsultbolag på en kraftig tillväxtresa och söker efter fler lösningsarkitekter som även kommer få en stor grad av inflytande och insyn i hur vi växer framåt. Vi bygger med ambitionen att ta ett helhetsgrepp om uppkopplade ekosystem och lösningar, från kretskort till digital tvilling, och söker dig som trivs i konsultrollen och samtidigt vill bidra till att skapa vägen framåt för TechSeed – **Tillsammans**.


Vi söker fler kollegor inom flera områden, men vi tror du kommer trivas om du är lösningsarkitekt med fokus på exempelvis:

* Systemutveckling
* Integration
* Cloud
* Cyber Security
* Embedded Software (C, C++)
* IoT, IIoT, Industriautomation, OT
* Data
* Innovation


Som delägare och anställd kommer du kunna vara med i utvecklingen av våra erbjudanden, medverka i exempelvis vårt Centre of Excellence inom Architecture, få möjlighet att påverka de områden som du drivs av och samtidigt få tryggheten av ett team med gemensamt mål och gemensamma intressen.

  


**Vem söker vi?**


Vi söker dig vars expertis är arkitektur! Vi söker dig som är nyfiken på ny teknik, trivs i roller där du utvecklas och trivs i en kultur där vi hjälps åt och bygger bolaget **tillsammans**. För att trivas behöver du ha **minst 5 års erfarenhet som lösningsarkitekt, teknisk arkitekt eller liknande roll**. Du behärskar relevanta **språk, ramverk, tekniker** och **metoder** för ditt område samt är lösningsorienterad och trivs i **samarbete** med andra. Eftersom vi arbetar med flera typer av kunder med olika behov krävs det för rollen att vara **o****behindrad i både svenska och engelska**, tal och skrift. Det är även meriterande om du har tidigare erfarenhet av jobba som **konsult** och har specifik branschkompetens inom exempelvis Automotive.

**Om TechSeed**


Vi är ett medarbetarägt konsultbolag i ScaleUp-fasen med visionen att skapa värde med uppkopplade lösningar. Vi tror på kombinationen av nära samarbeten, framtidens tekniker och att gemensamt arbeta för att skapa ett bolag vi verkligen trivs på. Genom att erbjuda **delägarskap** till våra anställda ger vi möjligheten till insyn och påverkan, samtidigt som det gynnar samarbeten och att prioritera vad som är bäst för gruppen. Detta speglas både i vår **kultur** och våra erbjudanden, där vi kombinerar vårt stora **tekniska intresse** med ett kundanpassat förhållningssätt samtidigt som vi har många sociala aktiviteter och en härlig gemenskap på kontoren. Vår arena är uppkopplade ekosystem, där tekniker som IoT och Intelligent Edge används för att skapa uppkopplade tjänster och system inom ekosystem som **Smart Cities, Smart Factories, Smart Companies** och **Smart Buildings**.


Vår grund ligger i att vi delar med oss av vår passion för teknik och värdet vi skapar. Det handlar bland annat om kunskapsutbyte och att dela idéer, bidra med god stämning såväl som att skapa värde genom vårt delägarskap. Vi erbjuder dig:

* Inflytande i hur vi bygger TechSeed tillsammans
* En öppen kultur där vi värdesätter olikheter, insikter och innovationer
* Direkt värde från våra finansiella resultat genom bonus och delägarskap
* Möjligheten att växa in i olika tekniska områden / ansvarsområden utifrån dina önskemål
* Flexibelt arbete hemifrån, beroende på uppdragets behov.
* Bra pensioner, försäkringar och 5000kr i friskvård

title: Head of data
description:
##### **Are you our next Head of Data?**


Join us at Kivra! We're looking for someone with a passion for data, a love for solving complex problems, and who thrives in agile development environments. We've grown tremendously and are looking for a Head of Data who, together with a team of motivated data professionals, will shape the future of data at Kivra!


At Kivra, we're building services that connect over 6 million people by providing a safe and accessible digital infrastructure that everyone in Sweden can trust and use. At the same time, we're saving trees, reducing the paper that's printed and transported by providing a better digital alternative to physical paper communication.

##### **What you'll be doing**


You’ll join Kivra's Data Platform Team as our Head of Data, where you’re directly responsible to lead, mentor, and manage a team of talented data engineers and analytics engineers. You’ll define the roadmap for the team and ensure the delivery of secure, reliable, and scalable data solutions. As part of the Platform Engineering Organization, you’ll drive the vision for how to develop our data platform following platform engineering principles and you’ll work to support the smooth collaboration and communication of all data professionals at Kivra. You'll work in close collaboration with technical leads, product leads, and other stakeholders across the organization. In your new role, you will:

* **Lead, mentor, and manage** a team of data engineers and analytics engineers
* Foster a **culture of growth and collaboration** in the data function, across engineering and analytics
* **Define and execute the data product roadmap**, ensuring alignment with business objectives and user needs
* **Oversee the design, development, and maintenance** of our data platform, including data pipelines, data warehouse, data services, and reporting tools
* **Drive the adoption of best practices** in data governance, data quality, and data security
* **Collaborate with cross-functional teams** to understand their data needs, translate them into actionable data solutions, and manage cross-team projects
* **Participate in strategic discussions** about Kivra's overall data architecture and technology stack
* **Evaluate and integrate new data technologies** to enhance our capabilities and efficiency


Our data stack is built on Google Cloud Platform. Tools and technologies we're using include BigQuery, Python, SQL, Kafka, Postgres, Airflow (managed by Astronomer), Tableau, Hex, Grafana, Docker, Kubernetes, Terraform, GitHub, and more.

##### **Who we're looking for**


Knowledge is important, but so is attitude! Kivra's culture is strongly influenced by kindness, drive, and the willingness to produce high-quality work. How you fit in with your team is super important for us – we thrive on being nice and helpful and always encourage growth.


We think that you:

* Are a **humble leader** with a passion for building robust and impactful data solutions
* Have **experience leading and mentoring** technical teams, ideally in a data-focused role
* Have a **proven understanding of data engineering principles** and best practices
* Are comfortable **defining product strategy** and communicating it effectively to both technical and non-technical audiences
* Have **experience in operational management of** **data platforms** and tools in production environments
* Are a **coach who guides less experienced team members** and analysts in improving their skills
* Have an interest in **data governance, data quality, and data security**, and experience with working with GDPR in data platforms


We also value:

* Working experience as a data engineer, analytics engineer, software developer, or similar role

##### **Additional information**


This role is full-time and our office is based in Stockholm. We encourage in-office collaboration and see that you also want to work on-site approximately 60% of the time. Fluency in English is required and fluency in Swedish is a plus but not required. Unfortunately, we are not able to sponsor new work permits, but are able to sponsor/renew existing work permits! The interview process will begin week 32.


##### **We Offer**


Kivra offers a role in a caring and committed team, in a company that is growing and continuously innovating. You’ll join a warm and friendly culture that thrives on collaboration and teamwork. You will be involved in shaping and influencing a product currently used by more than half of Sweden’s population.


Read more about our core values and benefits here: https://jobs.kivra.dev/!

##### **How to apply**


Easy peasy! Just send in your CV and cover letter as soon as possible. If you have questions regarding the role or the recruitment process, don’t hesitate to contact Sarah Ohlsson, Talent Acquisition Partner at sarah.ohlsson@kivra.com.

title: AI Solution Architect - Western Europe
description:
**About NetApp**
 NetApp is the intelligent data infrastructure company, turning a world of disruption into opportunity for every customer. No matter the data type, workload or environment, we help our customers identify and realize new business possibilities. And it all starts with our people.
   

  

 If this sounds like something you want to be part of, NetApp is the place for you. You can help bring new ideas to life, approaching each challenge with fresh eyes. Of course, you won't be doing it alone. At NetApp, we're all about asking for help when we need it, collaborating with others, and partnering across the organization - and beyond.
   

  

**Job Summary**
 As the Intelligent Data Infrastructure company, businesses rely on NetApp to help them drive value from their data, specifically in the area of AI and GenAI. NetApp Solution Architects are technology experts and evangelists in their fields and are considered the pinnacle of technical professionalism
   

  

 We are looking for an AI Solution Architect based in the Netherlands or Sweden and aligned mainly with the Western European market, but with EMEA-wide responsibility. The successful candidate will have demonstrable expertise AI, a curiosity for technology, and proven track record of designing AI solutions for customers.
   

  

 What you will do
   

  

* Collaboratively find, qualify, and develop new AI business opportunities
* Provide deep technical expertise to our customers and partners
* Design customer solutions that help drive business-oriented results
* Support all stages of the sales cycle
* Contribute to RFx proposals
* Build and nurture an external network of technical contacts
* Participate in one-to-one and one-to-many customer presentations
* Be the NetApp evangelist for AI in Western Europe and beyond


 What you will bring
   

  

* Demonstrable curiosity for technology and deep expertise in AI and GenAI data storage
* Outstanding communication skills with a track record of technology evangelism
* Strong history of AI solution design and proposal
* Self-motivated business developer


 Fluent English and either Dutch or Swedish are essential – other languages are a bonus
   

  

 At NetApp, we embrace a hybrid working environment designed to strengthen connection, collaboration, and culture for all employees. This means that most roles will have some level of in-office and/or in-person expectations, which will be shared during the recruitment process.
   

  

**Equal Opportunity Employer:**
 NetApp is firmly committed to Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) and to compliance with all laws that prohibit employment discrimination based on age, race, color, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, religion, disability or genetic information, pregnancy, and any protected classification.
   

  

**Why NetApp?**
 In a world full of generalists, NetApp is a specialist. No one knows how to elevate the world's biggest clouds like NetApp. We are data-driven and empowered to innovate. Trust, integrity, and teamwork all combine to make a difference for our customers, partners, and communities.
   

  

 We enable a healthy work-life balance. Our volunteer time off program is best in class, offering employees 40 hours of paid time per year to volunteer with their favourite organizations. We provide comprehensive medical, dental, wellness, and vision plans for you and your family. We offer educational assistance, legal services, and access to discounts. Finally, we provide financial savings programs to help you plan for your future.
   

  

 If you want to help us build knowledge and solve big problems, let's talk.

title: Implementation Consultant
description:

 Implementera nya kunder i lönesystemet HogiaLön Plus. **Ansvar**

 Utveckla processer och rutiner för att möta kundens och verksamhetens behov
   

  

 Hantering av önskemål från kund om kundanpassade beställningar
   

  

 Systemägare för lönesystemet HogiaLön Plus, hantering av systemuppdateringar och förändringar, ansvar för att kommunicera ut till service-teamet. Kontakt med Hogias support vid stöd och frågor
   

  

 Sedvanliga lönekörningsuppgifter såsom månadsvis lönekörning, semesterårsskifte, årsskifte tills en tilldelad resurs i service-team tar över ansvaret för kunden

 Ett strukturerat arbetssätt för att hantera arbetsbelastning och hantera kundernas förväntningar
   

  

 Bekväm i engelska samt svenska tal och skrift. Utmärk muntlig och skriftlig kommunikationsförmåga
   

  

 Förmåga att behålla fokus och arbeta effektivt mot snäva deadlines och flera prioriteringar

 Förmåga att hantera tredjepartsleverantörer, driva dem att leverera och samtidigt upprätthålla goda relationer

 Pedagogisk (meriterande)
   

  

**Förmåner**

* Hybridarbete
* 30 dagars semester
* Inkomstskydd

* Känna tillhörighet genom att gå med i en av tio Business Resource Groups där du kan ansluta globalt med nätverk och allierade som delar gemensamma intressen och erfarenheter.

* Få betalt för att betala framåt. Företagsbetald ledighet för volontärarbete för ändamål som du bryr dig om.


**Lite om ADP:** 
 Vi tror att våra medarbetare gör stor skillnad i en inkluderande, jordnära kultur som välkomnar idéer, uppmuntrar innovation och värderar tillhörighet. **Diversity, Equity, Inclusion & Equal Employment Opportunity at ADP:** 
 ADP is committed to an inclusive, diverse and equitable workplace, and is further committed to providing equal employment opportunities regardless of any protected characteristic including: race, color, genetic information, creed, national origin, religion, sex, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, lawful alien status, ancestry, age, marital status, protected veteran status or disability.
