title: Patent Professional
description:
**Join our Team**
**About This Opportunity**
 Today, Ericsson owns one of the ICT industry's most valuable portfolio of patents. The global patent portfolio consists of 60,000 granted patents within the areas of cellular technology, consumer electronics, cloud, networks and beyond. Ericsson’s Patent Creation Management is part of the global Ericsson GFGS IPR & Licensing Organization and is responsible for all inventions originating from all Ericsson R&D sites all over the world.
   

  

 We are now expanding our teams in Stockholm and Linköping, and are looking for motivated patent professionals (preferably qualified or partly qualified) looking to contribute to one of the industry’s largest patent portfolios. You will work for a company that is dedicated to research and innovation, leading the development of cellular technology including 5G, 6G and beyond.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
* Provide IPR support for Ericsson’s R&D operations wherein you will work closely with inventors and innovative technology in 3GPP Radio standardisation. In this role you will focus on building a world class patent portfolio related to 6G radio standardisation.
* Handling inventions in all stages from R&D project support, patent application filing and prosecution, and coordination of national filings up to grant in close cooperation with R&D, other patent professionals, and patent offices all over the world.
* Evaluate inventions and take value-based filing and prosecution actions including the drafting of claim charts.
* Participating in key projects supporting licensing and litigation such as business driven claim chart generation and rebuttal and participating in technical discussions.
* Collaborate and communicate with domestic and foreign outside counsel.
* Depending on your qualification and interest you will engage in patent portfolio management, oppositions and/or nullity actions to contribute to the value creation from our patents.
* Engage in working groups and projects to improve operations and strategies.


**You will bring**
* A degree in Engineering, Physics, Computer Sciences, or equivalent providing a strong technical foundation.
* Proven experience in patents such as Patent Attorney Qualification (also partly qualified) or working as a patent examiner or patent engineer & patent portfolio manager in the telecom sector.
* Understanding of telecommunication technologies, in particular radio air interface.
* A keen interest in technical, business and legal matters. Previous experience as an inventor, involvement in standardization, or project management will be an advantage.
* Analytical thinking and an eye for detail, paired with a solution-oriented approach.
* Adaptability in various situations and collaborative teamwork, with skills in coordination and communication.
* Ability to work independently and manage multiple tasks and activities as a team member.
* People skills required to work with a diverse group of engineers, patent professionals, and paralegals located around the globe.
* Motivation to learn and improve internal processes and tools.
* AI-based drafting skills are a plus.
* Proficiency in English.


**Application**
 We look forward to your application with CV in English. We target 60% work-from-the office. Last day to apply is 14th July 2025. Please note that we do not accept, proceed, or respond for applications sent via e-mail. If you have specific questions, you are welcome to contact
 **Yevgeny Meshulin** 
 , Sr. Talent Partner at yevgeny.meshulin@ericsson.com.
   

  

 Location: Kista or Linköping, Sweden.

title: Senior Field Engineer - Sweden
description:
Job ID: 2507479

**Location:** MALMSLATT, Ostergotland, SE

**Date Posted:** 2025-07-11

**Category:** Engineering and Sciences

**Subcategory:** Field Engineer

**Schedule:** Full-time

**Shift:** Day Job

**Travel:** Yes, 10 % of the Time

**Minimum Clearance Required:** Secret

**Clearance Level Must Be Able to Obtain:** None

**Potential for Remote Work:** No

 **Description**


SAIC is currently seeking a **Field Service Engineers (FSE)** to support the **Black Hawk Aircrew Trainer (BAT)** located onsite at **Malmen Airbase, located in Linkoping, Sweden****.**



This team is responsible for delivering high-level technical support, system integration, and field service engineering for the BAT Program. The position involves collaborating with military and civilian personnel to ensure the seamless operation, and maintenance of the BAT.


**Job Responsibilities:**


* This position will provide technical support services in support of maintaining and sustaining fielded BATs, equipment and software at the identified locations.
* Assist in the emplacement and initialization of the BAT.
* Advise customers on the capabilities and limitations of the BAT.
* Troubleshoot BAT hardware, software, and networks.
* Provide feedback to program leadership regarding system performance and end-user feedback.
* Perform operator and maintainer tasks on equipment, integrated systems, subsystems, and software.
* Conduct training when needed.
* Support Program Help Desk as required.
* Conduct scheduled equipment inventories.

**Qualifications**


**Required Education:**


* Bachelor of Science degree and five (5) experience; Additional six (6) years' experience accepted in lieu of degree or certified Aviation Simulation Technician level III or IV.


 **Required Clearance:**


* Must possess an active DoD Secret Clearance; US Citizenship required.


**Required Skills:**


* Experience with tactical networks and troubleshooting.
* In field operator training.
* Troubleshooting of computer systems and networks.
* Excellent oral and written communications.
* Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in high-pressure environments.
* Must be a self-starter and be able to work independently and efficiently with short term deadlines.


**Desired Certifications:**


* Black Hawk avionics experience.
* Aviation Simulation Technician level III or IV in lieu of education/ experience requirements.

title: Electro-mechanical Engineer
description:
**Description**


**The opportunity**

Do you want to enable the green energy transition, and together with colleagues meet the world’s needs for sus-tainable, flexible and secure energy?


In your work you will be part of HVDC (High Voltage Direct Current) business unit that is a part of Hitachi Energy’s division and is located in Ludvika. The unit develops, manufactures and sells DC transmission systems on a global market. Hitachi Energy’s developed HVDC technology is used to transmit electricity over long distances and for power transmission via submarine cables, thus enabling stability cooperation between grids, sea-based wind power and more.


Are you interested in combining high voltage topics with common sense, performing electro-mechanical studies as well as maintaining an overall plant perspective in large scale projects, all in a highly international environment? Then maybe you should consider becoming part of our team at HVDC!

**How you’ll make an impact**

* Perform studies and Finite Element simulations during tenders and project execution. You will be working on multidisciplinary technical aspects such as insulation, electro-thermal, electric- and magnetic fields and grounding to mention some.
* Support HVDC plant designers with multi-physics expertise in a design where current is in kA, power in GW and voltages are in the hundreds of kV.
* Be part of R&D activities to make sure we stay competitive also for the future.
* Most of the work will involve performing various studies at the office in Ludvika but since site measurements and verification inspections are included international travel is also part of the teams scope.
* In this role you will have a lot of opportunities to explore various technical fields exploring Multiphysics.

**Your background**

* We are looking for a Master of Science degree in an electrical field, applied physics, power systems or similar.
* Experienced professionals or fresh out of university – we are interested in all kinds of people as we are hiring for multiple positions.
* You have a keen interest in or understanding of mechanical aspects in order to combine Amps, Volts and Newton in your design.
* Experience in COMSOL or similar 3D simulation software is a merit
* Prior experience in any of the technical areas is beneficial but not a demand, your personality and interest are of high importance.
* As a person you are a positive, problem-solving individual with the attitude that everything is possible to do in a team. You will work in a team where being able to take responsibility and willingness to learn are key features.
* A general interest in technology is needed to be a good fit for this position. The goal is to have cost-effective solutions while fulfilling all requirements why common sense and understanding of practical aspects is beneficial.
* You should ideally like working in a multicultural environment and be able to express yourself written and spoken in English.

**What we offer**

* Collective agreement
* Flexible working time
* Health care and wellness allowance
* Fantastic career possibilities within Hitachi Energy both within Sweden and globally
* Mentor to support you throughout onboard phase
* Various trainings and education supporting employee development
* Diversified company with over 70+ nationalities working in Sweden
* Supplementary compensation for parental leave
* Employee Benefit Portal with thousands of discounts and perks

**More about us**


Are you ready for a new exciting challenge? Does the above description sound like you? Welcome to apply now! Applications will be reviewed on an ongoing basis, so don’t delay – apply today!


This position is based in Ludvika or Västerås


Recruiting Manager daniel.holback@hitachienergy.com, will answer your questions about the position. Union representatives – Sveriges Ingenjörer: Mikael Hjort, +46 107-38 29 86; Ledarna: Frank Hollstedt, +46 107-38 70 43; Unionen: Fredrik Holmgren, +46 107-38 21 85. All other questions can be directed to Talent Acquisition Partner Kevin Galloway, kevin.Galloway@hitachienergy.com

**Qualified individuals with a disability may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access the Hitachi Energy career site as a result of your disability. You may request reasonable accommodations by completing a** **general inquiry form** **on our website. Please include your contact information and specific details about your required accommodation to support you during the job application process.**
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

**This is solely for job seekers with disabilities requiring accessibility assistance or an accommodation in the job application process. Messages left for other purposes will not receive a response.**

title: Head of Customer Success
description:
Sleip AI AB is a Swedish technology company founded in 2020, specializing in AI-based software for gait analysis in horses using mobile phone cameras. Founded by engineer Axel Nyström and veterinarian and SLU researcher Elin Hernlund, combining scientific expertise, technological innovation, and strong market traction, Sleip AI is today a leading player in veterinary medtech, serving customers in over 50 countries.


In early 2024, Sleip AI completed a funding round, securing SEK 43 million in financing. Following the round, the company was valued at just over 250 MSEK. Among the investors are Karl-Johan Persson, as well as the German pharmaceutical company Boehringer Ingelheim which has also entered into a commercial partnership with Sleip.

**About the role**


Sleip AI is now looking for a key individual to help set the foundation and the development of


Sleip's customer experience in line with the global expansion.


As Head of Customer Success, you will hold responsibility for:

* Owning and developing the entire customer journey - from onboarding to renewal, loyalty and upsell.
* Identifying and acting on user data - including churn signals, activation points, and conversion flows.
* Leading and growing the Customer Success and Support team.
* Modeling ideal customer behavior - being proactive and building scalable processes.
* Establishing and refining systems for automation, follow-up, and reporting.
* Collaborating closely with the Chief Medical Officer to design and enhance onboarding and customer education, ensuring effective and sustained use of the product.
* Working closely with Head of Marketing and Head of Growth to translate customer insights into conversion-driving activities.
* Report to the COO, being part of the management team, contributing to building a global market leader.

 **Specific requirements for the role**

* Previously being responsible for (or being part of) setting up a Customer Success team within a SaaS company.
* Proven ability to lead, mentor, and grow Customer Success professionals in a fast-paced, customer-centric international environment.
* Experience integrating and implementing a digital Customer Success function, collaborating closely with IT.
* Strong analytical skills and experience working in a data-driven environment.
* Proven track record of working with KPIs and goal-oriented performance management.
* Experience working closely with customers – through calls, demos, and follow-ups
* Languages: Fluent English is required. Additional languages such as French, Spanish, or German are a plus.
* Experience as part of an executive management team is preferred.
* A passion for horses and animals is advantageous but not required.
* Academic background.

**Personal characteristics**


We are looking for a confident and grounded leader with strong commercial acumen and a natural ability to connect with people. You combine a customer-first mindset with a goal-oriented and structured approach.


You lead with integrity, bring clarity in complexity, and thrive in social settings. Entrepreneurial by nature, you’re hands-on, self-driven, and comfortable taking initiative. Your analytical skillset complements your business sense, enabling sound decisions and long-term value creation.

**Interested?**


If this role resonates with your background and ambitions, we would be glad to hear from you. Please submit your CV via the link below no later than August 4. We review applications on a rolling basis. This recruitment is conducted in collaboration with Aldea Executive Search.


For questions regarding the position or process, please contact: Lina Wijk at lina.wijk@aldeaexecutivesearch.se or Anna Sörelius Nordberg at anna@sleip.com
